description: Detects when cultural narratives, movements, or social structures use belonging and intimacy as tools to entrap individuals—often through flattery, role-locking, and isolation from outside ideas or people.

variables.L(t): Love-bombing through group identity ('you’re one of us now')
variables.I(t): Isolation (discouraging dissent, contact with outsiders, social penalties)
variables.V(t): Value diversity (space for other relationships, voices, exits)

response: If the only love that’s safe is from inside the group—it may not be love, it may be control. Belonging without freedom isn’t connection. It’s containment.
